MAY 1 1900

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
APR 27 1900

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 175 A 1900

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 49. }

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, April 16, 1900.

1. By authority of the Secretary of War, Captain Francis
G. Irwin, 2d Cavalry, now awaiting orders at Manzanillo,
Cuba, is assigned to duty at Santiago de Cuba, as Collector
of Customs at that port, relieving Captain Samuel D. Free-
man, 10th Cavalry.

Upon being relieved as Collector of the Port of Santiago,
Captain Freeman will rejoin his proper station, Manzanillo,
Cuba.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. 1st Lieutenant W. B. Folwell, 1st Infantry, now in
this city, will proceed to Santiago de Cuba, reporting upon
arrival to the Collector of Customs for assignment to duty
as Deputy Collector of Customs at that Port.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

3. A general court-martial is appointed to meet at Santa
Clara Battery, Havana, Cuba, at 10 o'clock a. m., on
Wednesday, April 18, 1900, or as soon thereafter as prac-
ticable, for the trial of such persons as may be properly
brought before it.
DETAIL FOR THE COURT.
1. Captain E. E. Gayle, 2d U. S. Artillery;
2. Captain M. F. Harmon, 2d U. S. Artillery;
3. 1st Lieutenant O. W. B. Farr, 2d U. S. Artillery;
4. 1st Lieutenant D. E. Aultman, 2d U. S. Artillery;
5. 2d Lieutenant W. W. Hamilton, 2d U. S. Artillery;
6. 2d Lieutenant W. B. Carr, 2d U. S. Artillery;

7. 2d Lieutenant E. B. Martindale, Jr., 2d U. S. Artil-
lery;

2d Lieutenant H. W. Schull, 2d U. S. Artillery,
Judge Advocate.

A greater number of officers cannot be assembled without
manifest injury to the service.
The court is authorized to sit without regard to hours.

4. Major R. Echeverria, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers, is
hereby assigned to duty in charge of such parts of U. S.
Military Hospital No. 1, Havana, Cuba, as have been re-
tained by the Military government of the Island.
✓

5. So much of paragraph 3, Special Orders No. 44, cur-
rent series, these Headquarters, directing Acting Hospital
Steward Frederick L. Minor and Privates Dexter C. Loud,
Franklin T. Carter and Charles A. Nelson, Hospital Corps,
U. S. Army, to report to the Chief Surgeon, Department of
the Province of Havana and Pinar del Rio, is amended to
read for them to report to Major R. Echeverria, Surgeon,
U. S. Volunteers, at Military Hospital No. 1, Havana,
Cuba, for assignment to duty.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:

W. V. RICHARDS,
Adjutant General.
